isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Orifice Tube System, Pre-March 2007 - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - HEATER CORE

note.para: Refer to Figure 33 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

warning.para: Allow the engine to cool down before removing the pressure cap from the deaeration tank. ALWAYS INSULATE the cap by wrapping it with a thick, heavy cloth. To prevent possible injury from scalding water or steam, DO NOT pull the pressure cap off immediately when it has been loosened to the first "notch." Pause momentarily to allow time for excess pressure to release through the overflow tube.

step1.para: Drain engine coolant. Refer to GROUP 12-COOLING in the Master Service Manual.

Remove cowl drain tray/HVAC air inlet. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, COWL DRAIN TRAY/HVAC AIR INLET
.
Remove both heater hoses (2) from heater core tube connections on engine side of cowl.

From inside the cab, remove blower scroll housing. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, BLOWER SCROLL HOUSING
.

note.para: The heater core is mounted at a slight angle and therefore retains a small amount of coolant in the core. Be careful to keep the core in an upright position until the coolant can be drained.

step1.para: Pull the heater core (5) out of the heater housing (6).

note.para: In the following step insure that the heater housing seal (7) that surrounds the heater core tubes does not become dislodged while installing the heater core.

step1.para: From inside the cab, carefully position the heater core (5) in the heater housing (6) so that the tube ends of the core protrude through the dash panel seal (7).
Install blower scroll housing (4). Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, BLOWER SCROLL HOUSING,

note.para: In the following step position the heater hose clamps to allow easy access for their next removal.

step1.para: On the engine side of cowl, install heater hoses (2) and clamps.
Fill the cooling system with coolant. Refer to GROUP 12-COOLING in the Master Service Manual, or the Operator Manual supplied with the vehicle.

note.para: Verify that the coolant system is leak-free before proceeding to the following steps.

step1.para:
Install cowl drain tray/HVAC air inlet. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, COWL DRAIN TRAY/HVAC AIR INLET
.
